TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DispIdAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies the COM dispatch identifier (DISPID) of a method, field, or property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can apply this attribute to methods, fields, or properties.
This attribute contains the DISPID for the method, field, or property it describes. Unique DISPIDs are typically assigned by the common language runtime, but you can use this attribute to assign a specific DISPID to a method. When importing a type library, this attribute is applied to all methods with assigned DISPIDs. This ensures that any managed implementation of the same method retains the same DISPID if exposed to COM.
See [DISPID Constants](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms221242\(v=vs.85\).aspx) for a list of commonly used DISPID values.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how explicit DISPIDs can be assigned to members of a class.
[!code-cpp[Classic DispIdAttribute Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.runtime.interop_13_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Classic DispIdAttribute Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.runtime.interop_13_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic DispIdAttribute Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.runtime.interop_13_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 dispId) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified DISPID.
Gets the DISPID for the member.
